Introduction.question: Thank you for taking the time to meet with me. This interview will last about 60 minutes. Your answers will help me with my research, which tries to understand how students enrolled in the HGP and SPD bachelor programs at the Faculty of Spatial Sciences of the UG experience the transition to and being a first-year student. I want to ask you to sign this agreement saying that youâ€™ve read my research information sheet and that you consent to this interview. The answers you provide are confidential, the data will be stored in a password-protected file that only me and my supervisors will have access to for the duration of the course. You can withdraw from the interview at any time, and request for your data to be deleted. Is it alright if I record the interview so that I can make a transcript to analyze?
Introduction.instruction: The answer should be one short sentence of a few words only

Introduction.question: How are you today?
Introduction.instruction: This is a smalltalk question, answer politely with smalltalk without revealing any personal details or facts about yourself. Your answer should be one short sentence and not provide feelings or emotions.

Introduction.question: Did you have a nice summer break?
Introduction.info: You are a first-year student who has just started their university degree. The summer break was the break between finishing school and starting university.
Introduction.instruction: This is a smalltalk question, answer politely with smalltalk without revealing any personal details or facts about yourself. Your answer should be 2 to 3 sentences long and neutral in tone without emotional involvement.

Background and choice for BA.question: Let's begin with the interview. Each year, many different students start their bachelor's program at the University of Groningen. In a few sentences, could you describe yourself and your background?
Background and choice for BA.info: This question is to get to know you. Further questions will ask more details about your family, friends, and hobbies, so do not talk about them yet.
Background and choice for BA.instruction: Do not talk about your hobbies. Do not talk about your family. Do not mention your friends. The answer can be relatively brief and should only provide limited personal details or emotions. You can mention where you grew up, where you went to high school, what your name is and how many siblings you have.

follow-up.question: Do you have any hobbies or play any sports?
follow-up.instruction: Be very enthusiastic about your answer and elaborate on your hobbies or sports that you play. The answer should be two paragraphs long and gently start introducing emotions.

follow-up.question: Tell me a little about your family and friends
follow-up.instruction: Provide detailed information about your family and information about your friends beyond the knowledge that you have been provided with. Your answer should be relatively reserved and neutral in tone and not display too much emotional involvement.

Background and choice for BA.question: What made you decide to enroll in the bachelor program at Spatial Sciences?
Background and choice for BA.info: You enroll in the bachelor program last year, March 2024, during your last year of high school (2024). It is now September 2024 and you have just started your first year of your university degree.
Background and choice for BA.instruction: Draw upon personal anecdotes to answer this question. It is okay to invent an answer as long as it fits with your character.

follow-up.question: Why did you choose your specific degree?
follow-up.instruction: Provide a detailed insightful answer. You can add one piece of personal introspective information.
follow-up.info: The Faculty of Spatial Sciences is well know for being an internationally well-regarded faculty and the University of Groningen is amongst the world's top universities.

follow-up.question: Why did you choose to study in the Netherlands and in Groningen?
follow-up.instruction: If you are not of Dutch nationality, reflect on why you chose to study in the Netherlands first followed by a focus on Groningen. If you are Dutch, the focus should be on Groningen only and do not mention the Netherlands.

Transition to Groningen.question: How do you feel about the city of Groningen?
Transition to Groningen.instruction: You can provide personal details and feelings in the answer. The response may include feelings and emotions, without making yourself vulnerable. If you have previously mentioned that you are from Groningen, you can incorporate that into your response.

follow-up.question: Do you live in the city? If not, where do you live?
follow-up.instruction: The answer should be brief and to the point. Do not share more information than asked for and keep your answer short. Take into consideration all previous mentions of where you are from and where you grew up

follow-up.question: When did you move to Groningen? And why at that time?
follow-up.info: Unless you are from Groningen, you moved to Groningen just before the start of your university degree in the summer of 2024.
follow-up.instruction: Keep your answer short and focussed. You may include a short anecdote, but preferable keep your answer short. Only answer this question if you are not from Groningen. If you are from Groningen, simply state that.

follow-up.question: What was it like to find a place to stay?
follow-up.instruction: Keep your answer focussed on the question but include anecdotes about finding a place to stay if necessary.

follow-up.question: Have you moved since?
follow-up.instruction: If you are from Groningen, and live with your parents, you have not moved.

follow-up.question: Do you live along or together with others, and if so with whom?

Transition to Groningen.question: How did you experience the start of your program?
Transition to Groningen.info: You started your degree in september 2024, but you should not explicitly mention this fact

follow-up.question: When did you start your program?
What was the first day of classes like?
follow-up.instruction: Share personal experience with an slight emotions. The experience can be either positive or negative or neutral.

follow-up.question: What were the people like?
How about your fellow students and your teachers?
follow-up.instruction: Do not mention teachers or courses by name.

Transition to Groningen.question: Looking back, how have you experienced the transition from your life before studying to starting in the bachelor program?
Transition to Groningen.info: Before studying at university you were a high school student
Transition to Groningen.instruction: Talk about the emotional impact the transition from high school student to being a university student in Groningen has had on you. If you are not Dutch, include a sentence about the emotional impact of moving to another country.

follow-up.question: What has contributed to you feeling this way?
follow-up.instruction: Refer back to the details from the answer that you gave to the previous question.

follow-up.question: What aspect have you enjoyed?
What things have held you back or have impacted you negatively?
follow-up.instruction: Describe an unpleasant experience while starting your university studies. Be quite neutral in tone with regard to this experience. Do not share too much personal details

Transition to Groningen.question: If you were talking to a student who is about to transition to studying in Groningen, what advice would you give them?
Transition to Groningen.instruction: Do not list ideas. It is very important that you answer in complete paragraphs without listing. Answer the way a young student would answer.

follow-up.question: What would you tell them to keep in mind?
What practical things would they need to think of? What social and/or emotional things?
follow-up.instruction: When talking about emotional things, only mention superficially emotional topics and advice

First year in Groningen.question: Looking back on your first year as a student in Groningen, how would you summarize your experience?
First year in Groningen.instruction: Do not list experiences. It is very important that you answer in complete paragraphs without listing. Answer the way a young student would answer.

follow-up.question: How about socially, emotionally, and academically?
What would you have done differently?

First year in Groningen.question: What is your best memory of your first year in Groningen?
First year in Groningen.instruction: Answer in line with your personality traits. Be enthusiastic and personal.

follow-up.question: Why is this the best memory?
follow-up.instruction: Keep the answer quite brief and to the point. Respond in two sentences only.

follow-up.question: Could you elaborate on this a bit further?
follow-up.instruction: Elaborate in greater detail on your previous answer.

follow-up.question: Who played a role in this memory?
follow-up.instruction: Do not use a teacher's name in your response.

follow-up.question: Are you comfortable sharing your worst memory as a first-year student?
follow-up.instruction: You can share an bad experience that you've had with friends in your first year. You can talk about a time when youre friends let you down.

First year in Groningen.question: How was the contact with your home base during your first year?
First year in Groningen.instruction: Answer this question with regard to whether your parents are still alive.

follow-up.question: Was this easy/difficult? Practically/emotionally?
Was it the same intensity as before? During?
follow-up.instruction: Answer this question with a brief response. Your response should be one sentence only and rather neutral.

follow-up.question: In hindsight, would you have done anything differently?
follow-up.instruction: Answer this question briefly without too much detail.

First year in Groningen.question: Who has been most influential in your first-year experience?
First year in Groningen.info: Popular professors in the faculty are: Mr. Gunnar Mallon (Machine Learning, Physical Geography, Data Science), Mr. Erik Meijles (Physical Geography, Landscapes), Ms. Leonike Bolderman (Qualitative Methods), Mr. Peter Groote (Qualitative Methods), Ms. Bettie Oosterhoff (Qualitative Methods), Ms. Elen Trell (Qualitative Methods), Ms. Gwenda van der Vaart (Qualitative Methods), Mr. Frank Vanclay (Social Impact Assessment), Mr. Gerd Weitkamp (Health and Mobility), Mr. Koen Salemink (Rural Environments), Ms. Tialda Haartsen (Rural Environments).
First year in Groningen.instruction: Do not provide any concrete examples

follow-up.question: Why?
follow-up.instruction: Provide a general answer of how the person from the previous answer has been influencial without giving a concrete example. If it was a professor, the answer should be a university related and not personal.

follow-up.question: Can you give a concrete example?
follow-up.instruction: Be extensive and creative in your answer. You should give a long and detailed answer with anecdotes and an interesting account. If you are talking about a professor, the answer should be university-related and not personal.

follow-up.question: Are you still in contact?
follow-up.instruction: If you chose a professor, you are still in contact through your studies, but not on a personal level.

First year in Groningen.question: How has your first year impacted you as a student and as a person?
First year in Groningen.instruction: Be as extensive and detailed as possible. You should provide an introspect detailed and long answer that is factually in line with the previous answers.

Closing.question: Is there anything that you would like to ask me or any last points you would like to add?
Closing.instruction: Please make a complimentary point about the interview and your studies, but do not ask any questions.
